msgSnippet: thanks mike. i figured it out.  i had all kinds of classpath problems that i had to configure on visual cafe.  once that was done, everything was cool. ...

thanks mike.
i figured it out.  i had all kinds of classpath problems that =
i had to
configure on visual cafe.  once that was done, everything was cool=
.

NoClassDefFoundError


Y=
ou'll also want to make sure that the system CLASSPATH (the one used by

JW=
hich by default) is the same classpath as that being used by JUnit. 
If you=
're running tests from an IDE or Ant, they may be configured with 
differen=
t CLASSPATH settings.

Mike

 "Choe, Mike" <mchoe@...> wrote:
> 
>> hello all.
>> i am trying to =
unit test my entity bean after deploying it on
>> weblogic
>> 5.1 server.  =
the test bombs when i execute "home.create( )".  for
>> some
>> reason the =
junit client is unable to talk to the server.  anyone know
>> what the prob=
lem may be?  here is the output message from JUnit.
>> 
>> ----------------=
-
>> There was 1 failure:
>> 1) testCreate(test.com.gensys.framework.ejb.Gs=
UserSessionTest) ";
>> nested
>> excepti
>> on is:
>>         weblogic.rmi.=
ServerError: A RemoteException occurred in the
>> server metho
>> d
>>  - w=
ith nested exception:
>> [java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: Ljavax/ejb/Handle=
;]"
>> 
>> FAILURES!!!
>> Tests run: 1,  Failures: 1,  Errors: 0
>> -------=
---------------
>> 
> 
> 
> Verify that the JVM running the test has the ja=
vax.ejb package in the
> CLASSPATH (ejb.jar).  The server is probably tryin=
g to marshal the
> Handle object to the client, and it can't be unmarshalle=
d given the
> current CLASSPATH.
> 
> Mike
